title: Excellent!!
pros: Everything is perfect. A okay
cons: None that I can think of

title: Don't do it
pros:
No overtime
No late nights
cons: Upper management is the worst

title: Micro Management
pros: Want to say the free food and car washes but those were dwindling down my last couple of months there.
cons: They want you 5 days in office because they like to micro-manage.

title: Unfair
pros: The pay was fair for the position
cons: This place is built on lies upper management does not care about you they will tell you one thing and then when you do it they will cover themselves be careful. They change policies without notice

title: Good but...
pros: Decent pay, easy work day
cons: DT and DM's don't take credit on anything. They like to wrap it around your neck and hang you for it because its to busy to get something done or there is a fault in the system.

title: Terrible company culture
pros: Free Coffee, soda, lunches and car washes.
cons: Stay away! Way overworked and underpaid!

title: No opportunities to advance. Stagnated.
pros: The people at the sites are mostly really hardworking and care about their properties. Bonuses for site managers and ASM’s is easy to achieve.
cons: Don’t be fooled by your interview, they will tout promoting from within but there is NO opportunity to advance in the stores beyond District Trainer. You can go from ASM to manager, if you’re willing to wait years. Store Manager to District Trainer if you’re lucky but those are few and far between and that’s it. District Managers are ALL hired from external and they have ZERO opportunities to advance. There are options to create more regions and promote District Managers but instead, they want to increase store counts for DM’s and put more on them. There has been a Vice President job open twice now and apparently nobody at the company is qualified for it. It would have been cool to see someone promote up because it would open an opportunity for someone else to advance.

title: Worst employer ever
pros: Hours are not too bad
cons: Absolutely do not care about their employees

title: they'll walk all over you
pros: I've been running a store by myself for the past month, there's a raging rat problem that no one is doing anything about 0/10 do not recommend
cons: literally everything about this place

title: EXCITING TO WORK
pros: PROGRESSIVE, GREAT MANAGMENT AND CORPORATE TEAM
cons: They could increase hierarchy at the top. Spread very thin

pros: Pay. Hours. Advancement. Training. Culture.
cons: Limited room for promotion or advancement

title: Hard Work
pros: Some locations offer housing and the benefits are decent
cons: Hard work. There POS systems are repetitive. One poorly written system feeds another. High expectations and demands in an environment that lacks adequate staffing.

title: Good money
pros: Good money if you put in the work
cons: I didn’t like that I had to follow a script

title: Stop! Be Smart!
pros: Days Off. Being home at a somewhat decent time if you don’t have to travel far away for work.
cons: Benefits are a joke. Denial and vision though I pay for them, couldn’t use them in my area. Had to travel to Seattle, I’m in the Portland area, to find a dentist that would take my insurance. Micromanage everything from how to move in to going to the bathroom. This company can’t keep people hired.

title: Decent work poor management
pros: Easy going, simple work, good hours
cons: Bad software, petty coworkers, slow

title: Dysfunctional company
pros: One of my coworkers is a decent human
cons: Micromanaged to death. No budget for facility maintenance projects. Unfair treatment of tenants. Programs used are terrible and do not communicate with each other. Only worried about numbers. Very high turn over rate. Corporate managers have no understanding of store level work and needs, most don't even have storage background. They do everything a** backwards. Incompetence is astounding. We shouldn't have to stand at the ATM with a bag full of cash to deposit either. You force us to be targets for criminals by doing that.

title: Great Culture
pros: No late Nights, 1/2 day weekends
cons: open on most holidays, because it is retail, but we are not that busy on those days and often times close early

title: Not great
pros: Not much good hours I would say.
cons: Pay, cleaning all the time.

title: Nice place
pros: Good company and good benefits. Good regional. Entry level sales training.
cons: Basic work. Basic pay. Weekends required.

title: Great Organization
pros: Great work life balance. Great company
cons: None that I can think of

title: Not horrible
pros: Not micro managed. Yearly merit increase reviews
cons: Only one metric to bonus off of.

title: Great Fun Company to Work For
pros: uncapped commission and a great team environment
cons: Calls can be repetitive and overwhelming at times.

title: It's a Job
pros: Management isn't great, employees are just a number.
cons: Not keen on giving raises, not remote.

title: Terrible Job
pros: Easy work, okay base pay
cons: Horrible upper management, no real support

title: Learning experience...
pros: You get to meet new ppl.
cons: There are not enough employees. You are forced to work like you are two ppl, especially at the beginning and end of the months; which are the busiest times of the months. Some employees request too many off days a month and it is never looked into or even discussed with those employees, There's one girl in particular that request at least 5 days off each month, she uses the same excuses every time and they fall for it each time.

title: The Kmart of the storage industry
pros: No experience necessary. If you love to be Micro-managed than this is the job for you!!
cons: Demanding the work of a 50+ hour work week all while being paid for 36 hours at most per week for a little over minimum wage and that's the Manager!!!! Benefits you cannot afford to use, because you are being paid $10-12/hour!! Understaffed and forced to do jobs that a maintenance person should be doing while simultaneously staying at the office to service every customer that walks in the door. You definitely Know you are replaceable at this job, because the DM is there to remind you of it at Every turn and that's within your first month. Being Micromanaged as if you didn't have two brain cells to rub together to make heat!

title: Manager
pros: Typically your day is pretty steady but sometimes it can get boring mid month. As long as you don't work a location with the rental trucks then this job is pretty easy. Follow procedure and do what they ask you to when they ask you to and things will go pretty smoothly.
cons: As a Manager you are not able to waive any fees or add credits to fix accounts. Also, the ordering system for cleaning supplies is very inconvenient. They also do not allow you to use petty cash for anything else but postage so if you forget something in your once a month order you are stuck without it until next months order or you have to run to another location, but they do pay you mileage.

title: Lipsticked Pig Ponzi Scheme
pros: Great office setting. Occasional office get-togethers. Decent work/life balance.
cons: The executive is more interested in themselves then the teams that support them, especially come bonus time. The COO gets his rocks off by speaking ill of past and present employees as if it's a sport. At the tail end of 2019, the company went through a self-administration procedure, yet nothing changed. "At the end of the day, it's still HMS's company" - CEO. It was done more for paperwork reasons than anything else. The company praises itself as a tech-forward company, yet in practice, they're just like every other storage provider, in some cases worse due to the lack of oversight. Leadership is vaporware.

title: They were not ready to run a business
pros: Trying to think of some, but very difficult.
cons: no support in place, dis organized, upper echelon does not seem to know what they are doing, does not care about-their customers or employees ( at least not that I experienced),

title: Poorly Managed
pros: The only pro is if you e not working in storage, then you get to work in storage.
cons: District leadership is a joke. They will work you to death and then ask for more. Things that are broken do get replaced/repaired. You do all of the maintenance on the property by yourself, I.e. cutting locks, fixing doors, fixing break ins etc. on top of mainting the office and monthly auction files. Very high turnover rate so you’re also always training.

title: Awesome opportunity with a growing company
pros: Advancement opportunities, better pay than it's competitors, supportive upper management, ability to run your facility with minimal micromanagement, growing company
cons: Typical storage industry challenges: it gets lonely with minimal person to person interaction at times. As with any company who has purchased another company, getting customers on board is a challenge.

title: Not a bad place to work.
pros: Worked in Houston District for a couple years. Decent place to work. Good district manager (Bethany Dalton) that was always supportive and professional. Decent pay for the area.
cons: Sometimes have to travel to cover other stores but mileage is paid. Weekend shifts are expected but Sundays are only 4 hours. Problems with properties are not addressed in a timely manner.

title: Not a rewarding job
pros: Reliable pay, no evening shifts
cons: Low pay, work all weekends, little to no bonuses, micro managed by upper management, no consistent schedule. High turnover...see over 12 people quit in six months in one district.

title: The inconsistency is incredible, Management are unprofessional
pros: Starts at $14.50 and you can possibly live on site for real cheap
cons: DM is disorganized, yardi system is a bust, equipment keeps failing (Gates, tools etc)

title: Bonus impossible to obtain and they hire upper management from outside instead of promoting within
pros: I am provided a place to live and the other managers are all supportive of each other
cons: Upper management hired from outside, bonuses impossible to obtain, no real help from upper management

title: Best Employer I've ever had
pros: Great benefits, easy work schedule, short weekend hours, always a possible bonus ( depending on your monthly numbers). A Company who truly care about their employees.
cons: Short staffing, not that there is an issue, this job just is not for everyone, a lot of calls and paper work but to be expected in an office job.

title: SmartStop Self Storage is a decent company to work for but I do not think their version of "full time" is fair.
pros: Quarterly bonuses, helping tenants during one of the most stressful times, moving.
cons: Rarely are scheduled 40 hrs and can be scheduled as little as 30 per week

title: Fantastic Company!
pros: A company that truly cares about their employees Great starting pay Full time work Great training program Promote from within the company Yearly performance based raises Continued support from upper management Monthly Bonuses Paid Holidays 401K Health Benefits
cons: You are expected to work on the weekends Lunch breaks are only 30 minutes Light janitorial work (ie: Cleaning bathrooms, sweeping halls, cleaning units) -For anyone who doesn't like cleaning.

title: Great Place to Work! Great Direct Upper Management!
pros: Advancement Opportunities Great Upper Management Benefits Great culture -- this is a company that cares about their employees Growth (personal and professional--when the right District manager is in place) Hours
cons: Small monthly bonuses Short lunch breaks

title: Not a family friendly company
pros: It’s a place to work!
cons: You have a total of 3 holidays off a year, all the others you work without holiday pay. You work under 40hrs, if you do get 40hrs you will possibly face disciplinary actions. The pay is not worth the kind of headache you will face due to lack of support from the overhead. Working at a fast food restaurant is corporate compared to the unprofessionalism of the overhead.

title: corporate life
pros: Some great and dedicated people Office perks water/soda free lunches on occasion
cons: Same as most corporate companies. Some people overworked and underpaid and others paid very well and don't actually work.

title: Terrible company, not just to their customers but to their employees.
pros: The hours. I liked my 9:30 to 6 schedule it was not too bad. Other than that nothing at all.
cons: Terrible. They constantly raise prices and are completely unorganized. They treat their employees like garbage and do not even give a discount to their employees. They are just terrible all around money hungry.

title: Assistant Property Manager
pros: good benefits from the company
cons: money driven only gives people who make fuss their way instead of people who actually need help. low pay for how much stress comes with working in the office usually wont get 40 hours a week

title: Company only cares about bottom line
pros: Not to strenuous of a job, a easy routine to get down, not a lot of traffic
cons: Bad upper management, they don't care about employees or customers, just payments

title: Discriminatory
pros: There are no good reasons, other than the office work is easy
cons: The pay doesnt match what youre asked to do, management doesnt ecen try to correct staffing issues at all, and they are wildly discriminatory. I was fired after I asked for FMLA and complained about my coworker leaving human excrement all over the bathroom.

title: A great place for college student to work!
pros: You get lots of free time, so you can do homework/studying on the side
cons: forget about to work ethics company policies and rule for their customer are not pleasant

title: It's okay
pros: Benefits are okay job is pretty chill and laid back.
cons: Hours are terrible. Very strange work life balance. not even close to forty hours, but there non-stop.

title: Great company to work for
pros: Benefits (medical,dental,vision,401K) Make your schedule with your property manager easy day as long as you stay on top of your work Pay
cons: Don’t get 40 hours a week

title: A company that cares!
pros: Stable company that is connected, during Covid the founder sent all employees a bonus check to help during hard times.
cons: Staffing at times can be a challenge

title: End of an error
pros: flexibility with work- life balance & meeting different customers
cons: multiple things to do with no help provided

title: Manager
pros: Customer Services, I love working with the public.
cons: Upper management, won't get rid of the weakest link. The pay

title: Homeless Hotel
pros: Lack of micromanagement. Good Benefits.
cons: Pay increases are not keeping up with inflation. Too many homeless.

title: Inside storage sales rep. Property also had Penske Truck leasing.
pros: Inside position. Easy to learn.
cons: If you didn’t make sales nothing else counted.

title: Not too bad
pros: Simple quiet work likfe no drama.
cons: Upper management can be better.

title: Love working here
pros: Decent pay and good hours
cons: Finding other good employees to work at my location.

title: Great managers, very supportive team
pros: Great location to work, the management staff was amazing.
cons: Open to many holidays and no holiday pay

title: Promises made, promises not kept

title: Company is great

title: Good job

pros: Pay is not bad. No overwork

cons: The basic pay was the bare minimum, making it challenging to feel adequately valued for the effort and dedication required for the role

title: Amazing Work Place

medical benefits
flexible schedule
less work load

title: funny
pros: hours are good, customers are relatively okay
cons: company loves to give money away to their customers (gift card give aways almost every week, sponsers ufc fighters, giving $10 000 away to the best 30 second commerical) but "doesn't have enough money to give to their hard working employees". talk about unappreciated.

pros: Benefits are really great for this job
